protocol.description:
This protocol allows layer-shell clients to hide and show their surfaces without destroying them. This is useful for popup menus and panels that need instant visibility toggling without the overhead of surface creation/destruction.
Hidden surfaces: - Are not rendered or composited (saves GPU resources) - Do not receive input events - Maintain their layer shell configuration (anchor, size, etc.) - Can be shown instantly without Wayland roundtrip overhead

interface.name: zcosmic_layer_surface_visibility_manager_v1
interface.description: This interface allows layer-shell clients to control the visibility of their surfaces.

request.name: destroy
request.description: Destroy this manager object. Does not affect any visibility controllers that were created.

request.name: get_visibility_controller

description.summary: get visibility controller for a layer surface

request.description:
Create a visibility controller for the given wl_surface. The surface must be a layer-shell surface (zwlr_layer_surface_v1).
Only one controller can exist per surface. Creating a second controller for the same surface is a protocol error.

interface.name: zcosmic_layer_surface_visibility_v1

description.summary: visibility controller for a layer surface

interface.description:
This interface controls whether a layer surface is visible or hidden.
By default, surfaces are visible. Use set_hidden to hide the surface and set_visible to show it again.

request.name: destroy
request.description: Destroy this visibility controller. The surface becomes visible if it was hidden.

request.name: set_hidden
request.description:
Hide this layer surface. The surface will not be rendered or receive input events until set_visible is called.
The surface maintains its configuration and can be shown instantly. This is more efficient than destroying and recreating the surface.

request.name: set_visible
request.description:
Show this layer surface if it was previously hidden.
The surface will be rendered and can receive input events again.

event.name: visibility_changed
event.description: Sent when the visibility state changes, either due to a client request or compositor action. Also sent immediately after the controller is created to provide the initial state.
